tag.name: cfquery
tag.help: Passes queries or SQL statements to a data source. It is recommended that you use the cfqueryparam tag within every cfquery tag, to help secure your databases from unauthorized users

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of query. Used in page to reference query record set. Must begin with a letter. Can include letters, numbers, and underscores.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of data source from which query gets data.

parameter.name: dbtype
parameter.help: query. Use this value to specify the results of a query as input.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username in data source setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password in data source setup.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to return in record set. -1 returns all records.

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Maximum rows to get at a time from server. Range: 1 - 100. Might not be supported by some database systems.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help:
Maximum number of seconds that each action of a query is permitted to execute before returning an error. The cumulative time may exceed this value.
For JDBC statements, CFML sets this attribute. For other drivers, check driver documentation.

parameter.name: cachedafter
parameter.help:
Date value (for example, April 16, 1999, 4-16-99). If date of original query is after this date, CFML uses cached query data. To use cached data, current query must use same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, password.
A date/time object is in the range 100 AD-9999 AD.
When specifying a date value as a string, you must enclose it in quotation marks.

parameter.name: cachedwithin
parameter.help:
Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original query date falls within the time span, cached query data is used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present, back. Takes effect only if query caching is enabled in the Administrator.
To use cached data, the current query must use the same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, and password.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled, but the Administrator Database Activity option is not enabled, displays SQL submitted to datasource and number of records returned by query. No: If the Administrator Database Activity option is enabled, suppresses display.
